text: does anybody know if it’s possible to declare style options for custom modules?
It’s not at the moment. But from what I’ve heard it’s something HubSpot is looking at providing devs access to in the near future.

gah! this is so close. by fetching another module, I realized the design tools add a `"tab": "CONTENT"` property to fields. I tried setting this to `"tab": "STYLES"` to which I got the error `Cannot deserialize value of type com.HubSpot.content.model.customwidgets.fields.group.Tab from String "STYLES": value not one of declared Enum instance names: [STYLE, CONTENT] (line:-1, column:-1)` and upon setting the type to be STYLE it accepted it! alas, those fields are now no longer under “options” but “styles” remains disabled. SO CLOSE! <@U6GNQ7JBU> if you wanna throw a little momentum behind this, I think it’d be so useful! in my case, I’m giving my users the ability to pick from a set of classes to apply margin, etc with predefined values
Yea we currently are working on module style fields but the project hasn’t been fully completed yet
